wiki.text:
A 'linear equation' is an algebraic equation in which each term is
either a constant or the product of a constant and (the first power of)
a single variable.

Linear equations can have one or more variables. Linear equations occur with
great regularity in applied mathematics. While they arise quite naturally when
modeling many phenomena, they are particularly useful since many non-linear
equations may be reduced to linear equations by assuming that quantities of
interest vary to only a small extent from some "background" state. Linear
equations do not include exponents.
wiki.title: linear equation
headings: Linear equations in more than two variables
